parts:
You are extracting a UBX protocol message definition from u-blox PDF manual pages.

TARGET MESSAGE: UBX-CFG-PRT
Expected IDs: class_id=0x06, message_id=0x00

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Extract ONLY the message named "UBX-CFG-PRT". Ignore any other messages visible.
2. Set the "message_type" JSON field based on the "Type" row in the message header table:
   - "Type: Input" → message_type: "input"
   - "Type: Output" → message_type: "output"  
   - "Type: Periodic" → message_type: "periodic"
   - "Type: Polled" → message_type: "polled"
   - "Type: Command" → message_type: "command"
   - "Type: Set" → message_type: "set"
   - "Type: Get" → message_type: "get"
   - Combinations like "Periodic/Polled" → message_type: "periodic_polled"
3. The payload table shows fields in order. Extract them exactly as shown with correct byte offsets.
4. Verify field sizes match offset differences (e.g., if offset jumps by 4, field is 4 bytes).

FIELD EXTRACTION:
- byte_offset: Exact byte offset from "Offset" column (integer, 0-indexed)
- data_type: UBX types: U1, I1, X1, U2, I2, X2, U4, I4, X4, R4, R8, CH
- For arrays: {"array_of": "U1", "count": N} - check Type column for "[N]" or "x N"
- scale: Include "raw" string and numeric "multiplier" if shown
- unit: Physical unit if shown (ms, deg, m/s, etc.)
- reserved: Set true for reserved fields
- fixed_value: For "type" fields at offset 0 (especially MGA messages), if the description
  says "Message type (0x01 for this type)", set fixed_value to the integer (e.g., 1).
  This value identifies the specific message variant.

PAYLOAD LENGTH:
- Fixed: {"fixed": 28}
- Variable: {"variable": {"base": 8, "formula": "8 + N*12"}}

QUALITY CHECK before returning:
- Byte offsets sequential and non-overlapping
- Field sizes match offset gaps
- Total field sizes match payload length

ARRAY DETECTION (CRITICAL):
- Type column shows arrays: "U1[6]", "U1 x 6", "CH[30]" = {{"array_of": "U1", "count": 6}}
- Offset gaps reveal arrays: offset 4 to 8 with U1 type = {{"array_of": "U1", "count": 4}}
- Reserved fields often span multiple bytes - verify size from offset difference
- String fields (CH) are usually arrays: {{"array_of": "CH", "count": N}}


Return the extracted message using the ubx_message_extraction tool.

{
  "class_id": "0x06",
  "message_id": "0x00",
  "name": "UBX-CFG-PRT",
  "message_type": "polled_get_set",
  "description": "Polls the configuration for one I/O port, or sets/gets the configuration for UART, USB, and SPI ports. When polling, a 1-byte message containing only the portID is sent as input, and the full 20-byte configuration unit is returned. For set/get operations, several 20-byte configuration units can be concatenated to one input message. Output messages from the module always contain only one 20-byte configuration unit. This message can affect baud rate and other transmission parameters. Changes may cause messages queued for transmission to be corrupted due to protocol changes; host data reception parameters may need adjustment to receive future messages including acknowledge messages.",
  "supported_protocols": [
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15.01",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 17",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 18",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19.1",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19.2",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.01",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.1",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.2",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.3",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 22",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 22.01",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 23",
    "u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 23.01"
  ],
  "payload_length": {
    "variable": {
      "formula": "N * 20",
      "description": "N is the number of concatenated configuration units (each 20 bytes long). A 1-byte payload is used for poll requests."
    }
  },
  "payload": [
    {
      "byte_offset": 0,
      "name": "portID",
      "data_type": "U1",
      "description": "Port identifier number (see Integration manual for valid port IDs). For USB, value is 3; for SPI, value is 4."
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 1,
      "name": "reserved1",
      "data_type": "U1",
      "reserved": true,
      "description": "Reserved"
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 2,
      "name": "txReady",
      "data_type": "X2",
      "description": "TX ready PIN configuration (bitfield): bit 0 (en): Enable TX ready; bit 1 (pol): Polarity (0=High-active, 1=Low-active); bits 2-4 (pin): PIO to be used; bits 5-15 (thres): Threshold (multiplied by 8 bytes, e.g., 0x000=no threshold, 0x001=8byte, 0x1FF=4088byte)."
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 4,
      "name": "mode",
      "data_type": "X4",
      "description": "A bit mask describing the UART mode (bitfield): bits 0-1 (charLen): Character length (e.g., 00=5bit, 11=8bit); bits 2-4 (parity): Parity (e.g., 000=Even, 10X=No parity); bits 6-7 (nStopBits): Number of Stop bits (e.g., 00=1 Stop bit, 11=0.5 Stop bit)."
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 8,
      "name": "baudRate",
      "data_type": "U4",
      "unit": "Bits/s",
      "description": "Baud rate in bits/second"
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 12,
      "name": "inProtoMask",
      "data_type": "X2",
      "description": "A mask describing which input protocols are active (bitfield): bit 0 (inUbx): UBX protocol; bit 1 (inNmea): NMEA protocol; bit 2 (inRtcm): RTCM2 protocol; bit 5 (inRtcm3): RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)."
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 14,
      "name": "outProtoMask",
      "data_type": "X2",
      "description": "A mask describing which output protocols are active (bitfield): bit 0 (outUbx): UBX protocol; bit 1 (outNmea): NMEA protocol; bit 5 (outRtcm3): RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)."
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 16,
      "name": "flags",
      "data_type": "X2",
      "description": "Flags bit mask (bitfield): bit 1 (extendedTxTimeout): Extended TX timeout (if set, port times out if TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5s; if not set, port times out if no activity for 1.5s regardless of allocated TX memory)."
    },
    {
      "byte_offset": 18,
      "name": "reserved2",
      "data_type": {
        "array_of": "U1",
        "count": 2
      },
      "reserved": true,
      "description": "Reserved"
    }
  ]
}

extracted_structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
extracted_structure.description: Polls the configuration for one I/O port, or sets/gets the configuration for UART, USB, and SPI ports. When polling, a 1-byte message containing only the portID is sent as input, and the full 20-byte configuration unit is returned. For set/get operations, several 20-byte configuration units can be concatenated to one input message. Output messages from the module always contain only one 20-byte configuration unit. This message can affect baud rate and other transmission parameters. Changes may cause messages queued for transmission to be corrupted due to protocol changes; host data reception parameters may need adjustment to receive future messages including acknowledge messages.

variable.description: N is the number of concatenated configuration units (each 20 bytes long). A 1-byte payload is used for poll requests.

payload.name: portID
payload.description: Port identifier number (see Integration manual for valid port IDs). For USB, value is 3; for SPI, value is 4.

payload.name: txReady
payload.description: TX ready PIN configuration (bitfield): bit 0 (en): Enable TX ready; bit 1 (pol): Polarity (0=High-active, 1=Low-active); bits 2-4 (pin): PIO to be used; bits 5-15 (thres): Threshold (multiplied by 8 bytes, e.g., 0x000=no threshold, 0x001=8byte, 0x1FF=4088byte).

payload.name: mode
payload.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode (bitfield): bits 0-1 (charLen): Character length (e.g., 00=5bit, 11=8bit); bits 2-4 (parity): Parity (e.g., 000=Even, 10X=No parity); bits 6-7 (nStopBits): Number of Stop bits (e.g., 00=1 Stop bit, 11=0.5 Stop bit).

payload.name: inProtoMask
payload.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active (bitfield): bit 0 (inUbx): UBX protocol; bit 1 (inNmea): NMEA protocol; bit 2 (inRtcm): RTCM2 protocol; bit 5 (inRtcm3): RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20).

payload.name: outProtoMask
payload.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active (bitfield): bit 0 (outUbx): UBX protocol; bit 1 (outNmea): NMEA protocol; bit 5 (outRtcm3): RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20).

payload.name: flags
payload.description: Flags bit mask (bitfield): bit 1 (extendedTxTimeout): Extended TX timeout (if set, port times out if TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5s; if not set, port times out if no activity for 1.5s regardless of allocated TX memory).
